intro: Papaver czekanowskii, commonly known as the Czekanowsky poppy, is a species native to the Carpathian Mountains in Central Europe. It is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its striking, vibrant red petals and a prominent, rounded seed capsule. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branched stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its natural distribution in rocky and forested areas.
